title: He proposed 60 years ago, then broke her heart. Now they've finally tied the knot
description: When Ed Sneckenberger broke off his engagement to Priscilla Matheny 60 years ago, she never spoke to him again. Then, the friend request arrived.

title: Soccer's Orlando Pride ditches players' white shorts over period concerns
description: It's the first National Women's Soccer League team to adopt such a change in uniforms. The goal is to make players more "comfortable and confident," the Pride says.

title: It'll be a runoff for Chicago's mayoral race — and the incumbent is out
description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Laura Washington of The Chicago Tribune about the results of the Chicago mayoral election.

title: NASA made history by knocking an asteroid off course. Now, it's publishing the data
description: Scientists are finally publishing all the details of what happened when a NASA spacecraft smashed into an asteroid to try to push it off course in September of 2022.

title: Eli Lilly CEO David Ricks comments on why it's cutting insulin prices now
description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Eli Lilly CEO David Ricks about the company's move to reduce prices on some older insulins and cap how much people have to pay out of their own pocket.

title: Eli Lilly cuts some older insulin prices and caps out-of-pocket costs
description: An insulin maker is cutting its prices. Eli Lilly, one of the three makers of insulin products in the United States, is also making other moves toward affordability for people with diabetes.

title: Look to the night sky for a dose of awe as Venus and Jupiter dance
description: This evening, right after sunset, the sky will display something beautiful: the brightest planets Venus and Jupiter will come so close to each that they will almost look like they might touch.

title: Nigeria has a new president-elect, but his opponents reject the results
description: Nigeria, Africa's largest democracy, has a new president — but he faces huge challenges, including reconciliation with the opposition after a bitter election.

title: The quake in Turkey and Syria left at least 50,000 dead. What about the survivors?
description: The earthquake that hit Turkey and Syria has taken a mental toll on survivors. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with trauma psychologist Dr. Alexandra Chen about the earthquake's psychological impact.

title: U.S. Intelligence: foreign rivals didn't cause Havana Syndrome
description: The U.S. intelligence community concludes it's "very unlikely" a foreign country is responsible for the so-called Havana Syndrome ailments involving U.S. officials working abroad.

title: Here are 8 big revelations from the Alex Murdaugh murder trial
description: How the jury interprets details is crucial: Prosecutors want jurors to find the South Carolina man guilty beyond reasonable doubt of killing his wife and son, based on circumstantial evidence.

title: Georgia football star Jalen Carter is charged in a crash that killed two people
description: Carter, projected as one of the top players in next month's NFL draft, was charged with reckless driving and racing in conjunction with the crash that killed a teammate and a recruiting staff member.

title: At least 36 are dead in Greece after two trains collided. Here's what we know
description: A passenger train and a freight train were traveling down the same track when they crashed head-on, sending the first two passenger carriages flying into the air, twisting backwards and catching fire.

title: Eli Lilly cuts the price of insulin, capping drug at $35 per month out-of-pocket
description: The moves announced Wednesday promise critical relief to some people with diabetes who can face annual costs of more than $1,000 for insulin they need in order to live.

title: TikTok sets a new default screen-time limit for teen users
description: The social media giant has introduced a 60-minute daily limit and other measures aimed at users under 18, as TikTok and other tech companies face growing calls to better protect young people online.

title: China's Xi heralds 'unbreakable' friendship with Belarus, an ally of Russia
description: The two leaders discussed the war in Ukraine, a week after China released a position paper on it, calling for a cease-fire and peace talks

title: Nissan recalls over 800K SUVs because a key defect can cut off the engine
description: Nissan says the SUVs have jackknife folding keys that may not stay fully open. If driven with the key partially folded, a driver could touch the fob, inadvertently turning off the engine.

title: China is buying more U.S. farmland, and some say that's a national security threat
description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Republican Rep. Dusty Johnson of South Dakota, who supports legislation that would ban Chinese investment in U.S. farmland.

title: China is buying up more U.S. farmland. Some lawmakers consider that a security threat
description: Lawmakers at Tuesday's hearing on U.S.-China competition discussed a range of threats, including China's foreign farmland holdings. A South Dakota congressman argues even a small amount is concerning.

title: LGBTQ+ youth are less likely to feel depressed with parental support, study says
description: Participants were asked questions about their parents' general parenting style and how that affected how their thoughts and feelings in the last two weeks.

title: 3 abortion bans in Texas leave doctors 'talking in code' to pregnant patients
description: Some doctors in Texas are so worried about the abortion bans, they hint to patients with pregnancy complications, "I've heard traveling to Colorado is really nice this time of year."

title: A reporter's indulgence no longer a secret — The NBA's Damian Lillard made me a fan
description: Damian Lillard has played his whole NBA career with the Portland Trailblazers. Unlike other star players, he has wowed fans in the Northwest with his demeanor and wisdom — including NPR's Tom Goldman.

title: Pandemic food assistance that held back hunger comes to an end
description: Millions of people who depend on the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program known as SNAP will see a cut of $90 a month or more. Some recipients say it will make it harder to buy healthy food.

title: More states appear poised to expand voting access for people who were incarcerated
description: There are a number of state-level efforts to expand voting access to people with prior felony convictions. One measure is on the governor's desk in Minnesota.

title: Let them eat turnips? U.K.'s tomato shortage has politicians looking for answers
description: Frost, floods, energy prices and Brexit are among the possible culprits in the shortage of tomatoes, cucumbers, broccoli and lettuce in the U.K.

title: Kobe Bryant family settles the helicopter crash photos lawsuit for $28.5 million
description: The figure includes a newly agreed upon payment from the county of $13.5 million along with the $15 million a federal jury awarded Bryant's widow, Vanessa Bryant, at a trial in August.

title: Fiery Greece train collision kills more than 2 dozen, injures more than 80
description: A passenger train in Greece carrying hundreds of people collided with an oncoming freight train in a fiery wreck in the country's north early Wednesday, leaving dozens dead and more than 80 injured.

title: Nigeria, Africa's most populous nation, elects Bola Tinubu as the new president
description: For Tinubu, it's the culmination of a deeply held ambition. But the elections have been criticized over logistical failings and violence that suppressed the vote.

title: A man charged with killing 3 officers was found dead in his jail cell
description: The shooting was one of the deadliest for law enforcement officers in Kentucky's history.

title: Wray publicly comments on the FBI's position on COVID's origins, adding political fire
description: On Fox News, the FBI director reiterated the agency's assessment that COVID was unleashed after a potential lab incident. That's not the consensus among intelligence and scientific communities.
